text: The 2019 London Marathon was the 39th running of the annual marathon race in London, United Kingdom, which took place on Sunday, 28 April. The elite men's race was won by Kenya's Eliud Kipchoge in a time of 2:02:37 hours – the second fastest time ever at that point. The women's race was won by Brigid Kosgei, also of Kenya, in 2:18:20.London Marathon 2019: Eliud Kipchoge wins, Mo Farah fifth. BBC Sport (2019-04-28). Retrieved 2020-04-25. The wheelchair races served as that year's World Para Athletics Marathon Championships. American Daniel Romanchuk won the men's title in 1:33:38 hours while Switzerland's Manuela Schär won the women's title in 1:44:09.London Marathon 2019: Daniel Romanchuk & Manuela Schar win wheelchair races. BBC Sport (2019-04-28). Retrieved 2020-04-25. In the under-17 Mini Marathon, the 3-mile able-bodied and wheelchair events were won by Henry McLuckie (14:25), Beatrice Wood (16:35), Zhou Zien (12:55) and Merle Menje (14:09).Virgin Mini London marathon 2019 results. London Marathon (2019). Retrieved 2020-04-26. A total of 414,168 people applied to enter the race: 56,398 had their applications accepted and 42,906 started the race.Stats and Figures. London Marathon. Retrieved 2020-04-25. A total of 42,485 runners, 24,735 men and 17,750 women, finished the race.London Marathon - Race Results. Marathon Guide.
